issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

assignee.name: dagw
assignee.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
A prepared statement with OFFSET/FETCH does not use the OFFSET/FETCH values after the first EXECUTE (e.g. 2nd invocation of EXECUTE).

NOTE: Only tested in ij with toursdb database

ij> prepare foo as 'select * from cities where city_id <= 10 fetch first 5 rows only';
ij> execute foo;
CITY_ID    |CITY_NAME               |COUNTRY                   |AIR&|LANGUAGE        |COU&
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1          |Amsterdam               |Netherlands               |AMS |Dutch           |NL
2          |Athens                  |Greece                    |ATH |Greek           |GR
3          |Auckland                |New Zealand               |AKL |English         |NZ
4          |Beirut                  |Lebanon                   |BEY |Arabic          |LB
5          |Bogota                  |Colombia                  |BOG |Spanish         |CO

5 rows selected

ij> execute foo;
CITY_ID    |CITY_NAME               |COUNTRY                   |AIR&|LANGUAGE        |COU&
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

0 rows selected

ij> remove foo;
ij> prepare foo as 'select * from cities where city_id <= 10 offset 5 rows';
ij> execute foo;
CITY_ID    |CITY_NAME               |COUNTRY                   |AIR&|LANGUAGE        |COU&
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6          |Bombay                  |India                     |BOM |Hindi           |IN
7          |Budapest                |Hungary                   |BUD |Hungarian       |HU
8          |Buenos Aires            |Argentina                 |BUE |Spanish         |AR
9          |Cairo                   |Egypt                     |CAI |Arabic          |EG
10         |Calcutta                |India                     |CCU |Bengali         |IN

5 rows selected
ij> execute foo;
CITY_ID    |CITY_NAME               |COUNTRY                   |AIR&|LANGUAGE        |COU&
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1          |Amsterdam               |Netherlands               |AMS |Dutch           |NL
2          |Athens                  |Greece                    |ATH |Greek           |GR
3          |Auckland                |New Zealand               |AKL |English         |NZ
4          |Beirut                  |Lebanon                   |BEY |Arabic          |LB
5          |Bogota                  |Colombia                  |BOG |Spanish         |CO
6          |Bombay                  |India                     |BOM |Hindi           |IN
7          |Budapest                |Hungary                   |BUD |Hungarian       |HU
8          |Buenos Aires            |Argentina                 |BUE |Spanish         |AR
9          |Cairo                   |Egypt                     |CAI |Arabic          |EG
10         |Calcutta                |India                     |CCU |Bengali         |IN

10 rows selected
fields.summary: Prepared statement with OFFSET/FETCH gives different results on subsequent execute

author.name: knutanders
author.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

comments.body: It looks like the offset and row count in RowCountResultSet are not reset properly in RowCountResultSet.close(). I've created a small JUnit test case that exposes the problem and committed it with revision 771613. It's disabled for now, but it can be enabled once the bug has been fixed.

updateAuthor.name: knutanders
updateAuthor.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body:
Uploading a patch for this issue, which also enables the test
Knut provided. Running regressions.

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

author.name: knutanders
author.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

comments.body: The patch looks correct to me. One small comment: The patch adds a test identical to the one I checked in. Instead it should just rename the existing test from xtestRepeatedExecution to testRepeatedExecution.

updateAuthor.name: knutanders
updateAuthor.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body: Uploading derby-4212-2, which fixes the issue with the added test. Thanks for looking at this, Knut. Committed as svn 772299.

updateAuthor.name: dagw

comments.body: Back-ported the patch to the 10.5 branch as svn 772327, resolving.
